title: BP Ultimate logo techno sans
content:
Hello, and thanks in advance.

Can anyone name this typeface ("ultimate"). Thanks again, -m

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109023855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bp_ultimate_3919.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bp\_ultimate.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109023855/http:/typophile.com/files/bp_ultimate.png) | 107.52 KB |
author: mpayson

comments.content: I have seen a font that looked like that, but without the dot over the m.

I like that "im" solution. Hrant should see this.

- Lex
The eps logo can be downloaded from [brands of the world](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109023855/http:/brandsoftheworld.com/search/?action=search&text=bp+ultimate)

One that is close is one I found in an old future-techno font printout from years ago called Mirth. I can't seem to find any info on it anywhere, and no longer have the font.

I'll keep looking and add any other finds to this post.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109023855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mirth_6512.gif)

...found another called Gia, but can't find any info for it either. I have a feeling they might be from Japanese sites I used to visit in my addict days.

Another with a similar feel if you removed some weight is Hemi-head 426 by Ray Larabie
